glosses: to leave, to cause or allow something to remain as available
to put, put down; to postpone, put off
to quit, to leave, to stop using

examples.translation: to leave the job for someone else

glosses: to leave, to drop, to deliver, to bring someone to a place
to leave a quantity of something after using it such as food, money etc.
to leave, to leave behind, to leave something after departure or death
to leave, to end a relationship with someone, especially a romantic partner
to forget about, to let go
to grow facial hair, to let moustache or beard grow
to cause someone to be in a situation
to let go, to release, to set free
to not allow someone to pass a class, exam etc.
(of animals) to give birth to a young one before the due time

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish براقمق (bırakmak), from Old Anatolian Turkish براقمق (bıraqmaq), from Proto-Turkic *bïrak-. Cognate with Chuvash пӑрах (părah), Azerbaijani buraxmaq, Gagauz brakmaa.
